channel.title: How do I use a live cd?
channel.description: I have a live cd for Ubuntu now...how do I get the comp to load Ubuntu from it...anyone?....

item.title: How do I use a live cd?
item.dc:creator: @MybBob MybBob
item.description:
@MybBob wrote:

Why dont you just put the disk in, reboot your computer and go to the boot menu, and choose boot from disk…?

Read full topic
item.source: How do I use a live cd?

item.title: How do I use a live cd?
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

try pushing all the F(number) buttons(not at the same time) when you start up and try to get to bios to change the boot priority

Read full topic
item.source: How do I use a live cd?

item.title: How do I use a live cd?
item.dc:creator: @Quilby Quilby
item.description:
@Quilby wrote:

There is no such thing as ‘not downloading a live cd’… it comes with every cd…
Do you have windows installed on the current comp that you are trying to install ubuntu on? if yes then when the computer stats up (with win xp) insert the cd and then load it up.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I use a live cd?

item.title: How do I use a live cd?
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

alright I’m trying that now, I’ll let you know in a min or so if it works…

EDIT Didn’t work I did go to the boot menu like you said and put CD Rom first still nothing…I’m e-mailing around and asking some other people who got the same burned disk I got from comp class if their’s worked…who knows maybe the teacher didn’t download a live CD? Anyways till I figure some of this mess out I’ll try any other suggestions people might have…

Read full topic
item.source: How do I use a live cd?

item.title: How do I use a live cd?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Well, this changes a lot between computers, but when your computer first starts, there is a black screen with some info about your computer, and maybe a logo or two, or a big image of your computer manufacturers logo. It should say something like ‘Press [some key, usually DEL or something] to enter setup [or BIOS]’ Press this, than look for something called ‘Boot Settings’ or ‘Boot order’ or anything with ‘Boot’ open/some how get to it, then change the first boot device to CD/DVD and the second to exactly what the first boot device was originally.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I use a live cd?

item.title: How do I use a live cd?
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

i have tried simply rebooting the computer, nothing happened…and I don’t understand what your saying for the 2nd suggestion…

Read full topic
item.source: How do I use a live cd?

item.title: How do I use a live cd?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Reboot your computer with the CD in the drive. If that doesn’t start up the live CD, then you will have to go into BIOS and change the boot device order.

Read full topic
